articles.title: WPK Birthday to Be Marked in Italy
articles.content:
WPK Birthday to Be Marked in Italy 
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- An Italian preparatory committee for celebrating the 60th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea was formed with due ceremony in Rome on September 16.
 Roberto Gabriele, general secretary of the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The committee decided to hold colorful events such as lecture, photo exhibition and round-table talks on the occasion of the 60th WPK birthday.

articles.title: U.S. Troops Pullback from S. Korea Urged
articles.content:
U.S. Troops Pullback from S. Korea Urged 
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization issued a statement on September 14 60 years since the U.S. forces landed in south Korea.
 Recalling that 60 years have passed since the southern half of the Korean Peninsula was occupied by foreign troops, the statement said that the U.S. forces present in south Korea are the stumbling block lying in the way of the reunification of the peninsula.
 It expressed support for the Korean people in their cause of reunifying the country and defending peace on the Korean Peninsula and urged the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea.    
 Abdul Wahab Rashwani, member of the Political Bureau of the Communist Party of Syria (Bagdash), said in a statement on September 15 that the U.S. should withdraw its aggression forces from south Korea without delay, stop its shameless interference in Korea's internal affairs and make a switchover in its hostile policy towards the DPRK.
 It is entirely thanks to the DPRK's strong military strength built pursuant to the Songun politics and its peace-loving policy that peace has been preserved on the Korean Peninsula and in the region around it, the statement said.    
 The present international situation evidently proves the validity of the anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. strategy advanced by President Kim Il Sung long ago, it said, affirming full support and solidarity with the Korean people's anti-imperialist struggle and cause of national reunification.

Greetings to President of Guinea-Bissau
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Guinea-Bissau 
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Joao Bernardo Vieira, president of Guinea-Bissau, on September 20 on the occasion of the 32nd anniversary of the proclamation of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished the president and the people of Guinea-Bissau successes in their work for peace, stability and prosperity of the country.

UN Secretary General Meets Head of DPRK Delegation
articles.content:
UN Secretary General Meets Head of DPRK Delegation
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- UN Secretary General Kofi Annan on Sept. 21 met Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Choe Su Hon who is leading the DPRK delegation to the 60th Session of the UN General Assembly.
 The adoption of a joint statement at the recent six-party talks has been very encouraging, he said, adding that this provided a breakthrough in the settlement of the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula.    
 On hand were some members of the DPRK delegation, the permanent representative of the DPRK in the UN, the UN under-secretary general for humanitarian affairs and the political director of the Executive Office of the secretary general.

National Solo Contest of Schoolchildren Held
articles.content:
National Solo Contest of Schoolchildren Held
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The 22nd national vocal solo, solo performance and solo dance contest of schoolchildren was held here in celebration of the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
 It drew members of art groups of schoolchildren's palaces (halls) in different parts of the country and talented pupils of primary and middle schools selected from provincial contests.    
 Contesters displayed high artistic skills in such songs as "Our Country Is the Country of the General", "Hopeful Is the Future of Us under the Care of the General", "Our Best Country" "May the Playing of My Accordion Resound Forth" and "My Photograph" and dances such as "Drum Dance," "On the Way to School" and "Dance with Tops". 
 Instrumental music pieces including "A Series of Revolutionary Songs" and "A Post in Spring" played by schoolchildren with national and western musical instruments such as Kayagum, Jangsaenap and flute were highly appreciated for their high skills.
 The jury of the contest announced those from Pyongyang, North Hwanghae, South Hamgyong and North Phyongan provinces as successful participants. 
 Coming first in the contest were Jon Jin Song of the Schoolchildren's Palace of "250 Mile-Journey for National Liberation", Pak Kum Song of Wolbong Middle School of Songrim City, Ko Pom Hyang of Kwangmyong Primary School of Hamhung City, Kwon Hyok of the  Pongnam Primary School of Pyongyang, Ko Yun Song of Paeksa Primary School of Sinuiju City, Ri Mok Ran of the Schoolchildren's Hall of Haeju City, Jon Ok Gyong of the Schoolchildren's Hall of Kumya County and Han Yun Mi of Soryong Middle School of Pyongyang and 43 others.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Official
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Official
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Governor of the Ivanovo Regional Administration of Russia Vladimir Iliich Tikhonov. 
 It was handed to an official concerned Friday by Vice-Governor Vera Gennadyevna Dobrolyubova, director of the Cultural and Art Department of the administration, who is Russia's People's Artiste, now on a visit to the DPRK as a member of the State Academy Ensemble of the Ministry of Interior of Russia.
